On August 4, 2007, Automatix was reviewed by [https://launchpad.net/~mjg59 Matthew Garrett], a member of the core Ubuntu development team. In his words, âAutomatix is, in itself, a poor quality package which fails to conform to Debian or Ubuntu policy.â These comments were made in a technical analysis posted on his blog explaining why Automatix is currently not supported by [[Canonical_Ltd.|Canonical Ltd.]] or the Ubuntu community.<ref>[http://mjg59.livejournal.com/77440.html mjg59: Anyway, back to pure Linux stuff. == Alternatives ==
  +
Installing the package [[ubuntu-restricted-extras]], installs the most commons "restricted" things a user might need (support for [[MP3]] and [[DVD-Video|DVD]] playback, Microsoft fonts,
  +
[[Java Virtual Machine|Java runtime environment]], [[Adobe Flash Player|Flash plugin]], common [[codec|codecs]], etc...)
